segment.source: Before starting your compatibility testing on the version of Windows that you want to deploy, you can use the Application Compatibility Toolkit (ACT) to identify which applications should be the focus of your testing.
segment.target: Before starting your compatibility testing on the version of Windows that you want to deploy, you can use the Application Compatibility Toolkit (ACT) to identify which applications should be the focus of your testing.

segment.source: Before starting your compatibility testing on the version of Windows that you want to deploy, you can use the Application Compatibility Toolkit (ACT) to identify which applications should be the focus of your testing.
segment.target: Before starting your compatibility testing on the version of Windows that you want to deploy, you can use the Application Compatibility Toolkit (ACT) to identify which applications should be the focus of your testing.

segment.source: To choose the applications to include in compatibility testing
segment.target: To choose the applications to include in compatibility testing

segment.source: Gather your application and device inventory.
segment.target: Gather your application and device inventory.

segment.source: For more information, see Taking Inventory of Your Organization.
segment.target: For more information, see Taking Inventory of Your Organization.

segment.source: Use the Microsoft Compatibility Exchange to get the latest compatibility ratings.
segment.target: Use the Microsoft Compatibility Exchange to get the latest compatibility ratings.

segment.source: For more information, see Sending and Receiving Compatibility Data.
segment.target: For more information, see Sending and Receiving Compatibility Data.

segment.source: Organize and group your applications, and determine which applications need to be tested.
segment.target: Organize and group your applications, and determine which applications need to be tested.

segment.source: For more information, see Organizing Your Compatibility Data.
segment.target: For more information, see Organizing Your Compatibility Data.

segment.source: After completing these steps, you can then start creating and deploying your runtime-analysis packages to the test environment for your compatibility testing.
segment.target: After completing these steps, you can then start creating and deploying your runtime-analysis packages to the test environment for your compatibility testing.

segment.source: Creating an Enterprise Environment for Compatibility Testing
segment.target: Creating an Enterprise Environment for Compatibility Testing
